opt.英释: to choose one thing or do one thing instead of another

vex.英释: to make someone feel annoyed or worried

sue.英释: to make a legal claim against someone, especially for money, because they have harmed you in some way

rip.英释: to tear something or be torn quickly and violently

let.英释: to allow someone to do something

dot.英释: to mark something by putting a dot on it or above it

nap.英释: a short sleep, especially during the day

pit.英释: a hole in the floor of a garage that lets you get under a car to repair it

due.中释: 应支付的，正当的，预定应到的(to)，由于
due.英释: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

dip.英释: to put something into a liquid and lift it out again

rub.英释: to move your hand, or something such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly

hum.英释: to make a low continuous sound

dam.英释: a special wall built across a river or stream to stop the water from flowing, especially in order to make a lake or produce electricity

one.英释: a piece of paper money worth one dollar

hug.英释: to put your arms around someone and hold them tightly to show love or friendship

ego.中释: 自我，自己，个人思考和感觉能力
ego.英释: the opinion that you have about yourself

rot.英释: to decay by a gradual natural process, or to make something do this

apt.英释: exactly right for a particular situation or purpose

cue.英释: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen

jog.中释: 轻推，轻撞，缓步前进，漫跑
jog.英释: to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising

pay.英释: to give someone money for the job they do

tug.英释: to pull with one or more short, quick pulls

ore.英释: rock or earth from which metal can be obtained

tow.英释: to pull a vehicle or ship along behind another vehicle, using a rope or chain

din.英释: a loud unpleasant noise that continues for a long time

rim.英释: the outside edge of something circular

put.英释: to move something to a particular place or position, especially using your hands

tap.英释: to hit your fingers lightly on something, for example to get someone’s attention

say.英释: to express an idea, feeling, thought etc using words

sow.英释: to plant or scatter seeds on a piece of ground

pry.英释: to try to find out details about someone else’s private life in an impolite way

cut.中释: 割，切，剪，砍，削；离开；(线条)相交
cut.英释: to divide something or separate something from its main part, using scissors, a knife etc

fry.英释: to cook something in hot fat or oil, or to be cooked in hot fat or oil

wit.英释: your ability to think quickly and make the right decisions

odd.中释: 古怪的，奇数的；单独的；零头的；临时的
odd.英释: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand

dub.中释: (以某种称号)授予；给起绰号；复制
dub.英释: to give something or someone a name that describes them in some way

log.英释: a thick piece of wood from a tree

pin.中释: 用别针别住；钉住，使不能行动
pin.英释: to make someone unable to move by putting a lot of pressure or weight on them

mar.英释: to make something less attractive or enjoyable

lay.英释: to put someone or something down carefully into a flat position

flu.英释: a common illness that makes you feel very tired and weak, gives you a sore throat, and makes you cough and have to clear your nose a lot

tag.英释: a small piece of paper, plastic etc attached to something to show what it is, who owns it, what it costs etc

oar.英释: a long pole with a wide flat blade at one end, used for rowing a boat

web.英释: the system on the Internet that allows you to find and use information that is held on computers all over the world

lap.中释: (跑道的)一圈；腰以下及大腿的前面部分
lap.英释: the upper part of your legs when you are sitting down

fee.英释: an amount of money that you pay to do something or that you pay to a professional person for their work

lag.英释: a delay or period of waiting between one event and a second event

air.英释: the mixture of gases around the Earth, that we breathe

dim.英释: if a light dims, or if you dim it, it becomes less bright

eye.英释: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with

get.中释: 使得，使成为某种状态，开始起来

hop.英释: to move by jumping on one foot

wax.英释: to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

owe.英释: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

end.英释: a situation in which something is finished or no longer exists

lax.英释: not strict or careful enough about standards of behaviour, work, safety etc

tar.英释: a black substance, thick and sticky when hot but hard when cold, used especially for making road surfaces

hit.英释: to touch someone or something quickly and hard with your hand, a stick etc
